text:
everyone welcome to Pai's kitchen so today I am 
making braised chicken wings with caramelized

onions now this is the dish that my mother-in-law 
makes quite often and it's one of those dishes

that looks really luxurious and complex looks like 
it took hours to make but really it only takes

like 30 minutes to cook from start to finish it's 
also really kid-friendly because it's not spicy

and what kid doesn't love chicken wings right and 
it's freezer friendly so it's a great thing for

you to pack into the freezer and thaw whenever you 
need it and it thaws really well like you almost

can't tell that it was ever frozen before so it's 
a really good one to have in your rotation all

right let's get started so I've got some chicken 
wings here that I actually have marinated in some

soy sauce and a little bit of sugar and the sugar 
just helps it Brown a little faster you can omit

it if you want I did this yesterday but you can 
also do it just 30 minutes before that would be

plenty of time to marinate which now come to think 
of it when I said it takes 30 minutes that doesn't

include marinating time I think that's something 
you do that's the prep part okay it's a little

moist we're gonna sear it so I'm just gonna dry 
the chicken with some paper towel just to get

excess moisture off so it doesn't splatter too 
much when we go to fry it and I just like grab

my paper towel with tongs and stir it around 
and it seems to work pretty well then I don't

get my hands dirty okay and now I'm just gonna 
dust this with a little bit of cornstarch this

is also optional I just find it Sears up a little 
nicer if you don't have a non-stick pan it helps

prevent the chicken from sticking gives it a bit 
of a crust that's all as you can see it's a almost

invisible amount of coating you can use a big pot 
or a skillet I'm using this wok here but whatever

you're using make sure you have a lid for it 
because we're gonna need to cover it turn my

heat on make sure you put enough oil to coat the 
bottom and we're gonna sear the chicken just to

get some color on the outside and that Browning 
is extra flavor that is why you want to do this

step by the way I'm only realizing now that this 
pack of chicken wings that I bought only came with

drums which is not what I was going for cuz I like 
the flats it feels like I got ripped off oh look

I have one flat okay so we won't crowd the pan 
so I'll do this in two batches alright let's see

yes that is what you're going for nice and 
brown lots of good flavor there same reason

why fried chicken tastes better than boiled 
chicken you almost wanted to stop it here and

just eat it like no need to do anything else 
and depending on your level of commitment you

can sear both sides or if you're like one side 
I'm good I'm done you can be done with it as

well so we're not trying to cook it we're 
just trying to get a little extra flavor so

in the same pan with all that chicken fat and 
browned bits all that good flavor we're gonna

use that to saute our onion so I've got 
a whole bunch of onions and to help the

onions cook faster I'm gonna add just a bit 
of salt and the salt will draw out moisture

from the onion by the way you feel like there 
was too much oil at the bottom of the pan you

can just pour some out okay so I'm getting 
some color on my onion now and you'll notice

I've got some brown bits on the pan right there 
I'm gonna deglaze with some water and then it'll

release all the young innocents and you want 
to do that as you go so that you don't end

up burning all those fits to the bottom of the 
pan mm-hmm but now you're starting to smell that

caramelized onions so I'd be glazed a total of two 
to three times at this point and I am keeping my

heat pretty high so I get the browning fast so 
now I'm gonna add my garlic and lots of ginger

get that stirred up and I'm only adding the 
garden the ginger notice the garlic tends to

burn quite easily so give that just a couple 
of minutes I'll do one last deglaze very nice

now the chicken goes back in give that toss it 
smells so good right now with the ginger and the

onions extra seasoning I'm gonna add some oyster 
sauce some dark soy sauce for color some Chinese

cooking wine totally optional you don't have to 
add it and Chinese cooking wine by the way it

comes in a bottle like this you just need to stir 
that stir all this together oh my goodness looks

so good and then I'm going to add just enough 
water to sort of come up halfway because the

chicken wings themselves are going to give off 
quite a bit of liquid so you just wanna have

enough to get it going so it doesn't burn to the 
bottom as it gets started cooking uvl there be a

lot more liquid that comes out so now the heat 
goes low whoo almost forgot I'm going to add

some pepper you can do black pepper I'm gonna 
do a white pepper just because it's right here

if you want it a little darker you can add some 
more dark soy sauce which I think I'm going to do

there you go that's more along the lines of what 
I was hoping for a touch more water I think and

then I'm gonna cover it and it only takes 
20 minutes from this point onwards for the

chicken to become fork tender but still holding 
on to the bone not falling apart so time to get

your rice on oh look at that and look how much 
liquid has come out right so that's why you

don't want to be overzealous with adding water 
to begin with let me give this a quick stir oh

very nice look at all that oh and by the way for 
our patreon members for the show after the show

today I'm gonna share with you my cooking time 
guidelines for braising all sorts of different

types of meat and if you want to know more about 
becoming a member on patreon I'll put the link

in the description below all right so look at 
that oh look at those soft caramelized onions

now I'm gonna finish this off with some greenery 
of course some green onions always saves the day

makes everything look insanely better you can 
do cilantro too if you want of course oh look

at that look at all those onions and of course 
you want to give this a taste because now an

unknown amount of liquid has come out of the 
chickens you want to make sure that you're

seasoning is still on point mmm that is perfect 
perfect perfect perfect but if you feel like oh

this needs a little bit of soy sauce or a little 
bit of oyster sauce that is completely normal go

ahead and add it you haven't done anything wrong 
also sometimes if I happen to have some lemon on

hand I like a quick squeeze just a little bit of 
lemon juice to brighten everything up or some nice

vinegar to give it a little bit of an acidity as 
well but to keep it simple this is plenty good

all right let's dish this up oh yes extra sauce 
and this sauce is so right now I'm telling you

like this is one of those sauces that as soon 
as it cools down it gels into gelatin because

it's just so rich with all those bones from the 
chicken lots of protein really good for you uh

and the chicken super tender my fork goes right 
through really easy to pull it apart with just

a fork and a spoon and I can smell that ginger 
mmm that onion just melts in your mouth perfect

super tender chicken really sort of well-balanced 
flavor but it's got that kick of ginger to keep it

interesting again like this just look like this 
arrives on the table you garnish it with green

onions or whatever and it just looks luxurious 
looks like somebody took ours right to slowly

cook this and it and it really is quite simple 
especially if you plan to marinate your chicken

a day in advance it can go rather quickly but 
it's also again really really kid-friendly its

freezer friendly it's a super useful dish to have 
in your rotation trust me if you make it once you

want to make it again and again because it's so 
good and so easy so the recipe as always will

be on hot Thai kitchen tom and when you make 
it definitely you want to see what it looks

like so send me a photo on Facebook Twitter or

am on there if you haven't subscribed to the show 
make sure you do so you don't miss a recipe like

this and click the bell icon as well so you get

you as always for watching and I will see you 
next time for your next delicious adventure you
